title: Drawing, "Project for a Ewer", ca. 1765
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and black and grey wash, graphite
provenance: From the collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The handle is at left. Its bottom part consists of a satyr who is embraced by a mermaid seated on the shoulder of the ewer. A swan and two girls surround the neck of the vessel. The fluted body show festoons suspended from a faun's mask. S

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a Ewer", ca. 1765.
ca. 1765. Pen and black ink, brush and black and grey wash, graphite. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-50.
